calculateEngravingDefaults

This script measures and sets engraving defaults based on the dimensions, registration, metrics and/or point placement of appropriate font glyphs.

With limited means of identification and control over the necessary parameters, the script presently relies on a rather rudimentary and somewhat error-prone process for calculating values. For this reason, the results should be used only as a starting point for setting the values of EngravingDefaults attributes.

The user has the option to override or skip any automatic measurements, as well as reassign attributes to different ruler functions or glyphs than the default. This is particularly useful for automatic measurements of line widths for e.g. octave lines, pedal lines or repeat endings, which are not represented by a particular SMuFL glyph, but are often based on the thickness of other lines, such as staff lines, leger lines, barlines, etc., depending on the desired thickness.

Note

The setting for textFontFamily, which involves no measuring or calculation, has to be set manually with the override parameter.

This script requires that SMufoLib be installed within its executive environment. It may also be imported as a module and contains the following public functions:

  • main() – Main function of the script.

  • boundsLeft() – Returns absolute value of bounds x minimum.

  • boundsHeight() – Returns absolute value of bounds height.

  • stemDot() – Measures distance between stem and dot countour.

  • xInner() – Measures distance between two adjacent x points of different contours.

  • xOrigin() – Measures distance between two adjacent x points closest to origin.

  • yInner() – Measures distance between two adjacent y points of different contours.

  • yMinimum() – Measures distance between two adjacent low-points on y axis.

main(font, exclude=None, override=None, remap=None, spaces=False)[source]

Main function of the script.

Parameters:

  • font (Font | Path | str) – Target font object or path to file.

  • exclude (str | list | None) – EngravingDefaults attributes to exclude. Defaults to None.

  • override (dict[str, int | float] | None) – EngravingDefaults attributes to manually override mapped to their values. Defaults to None.

  • remap (dict[str, dict[str, str | int]] | None) –

    EngravingDefaults attributes mapped to remappings dict, e.g.:

    r = {
    'arrowShaftThickness': {
        'ruler': 'boundsLeft',
        'glyph': 'uniEB60',
        'referenceIndex': 2
    }
}

    Defaults to None.

  • spaces (bool) – set units of measurement to font units or spaces. Defaults to False.

Return type:

None

checkAnchors

This script checks font anchors against the metadata file of SMuFL’s reference font, Bravura, to find missing or superfluous glyph anchors according to the SMuFL standard.

Discrepancies are printed to console, and glyphs may be marked with color value specified in smufolib.cfg. Glyphs without annotated smufl names or glyph names will be skipped.

This script requires that SMufoLib be installed within its executive environment. It may also be imported as a module and contains the following public funcitons:

  • main() – main function of the script. See function help

    for parameter details.

main(font, fontData=Request(CONFIG['metadata.paths']['referenceFont'], CONFIG['metadata.fallbacks']['referenceFont']), mark=False, color=None)[source]

Main function of the script.

Parameters:

  • font (Font | Path | str) – Object or path to target Font.

  • fontData (Request | Path | str) – Object call or direct path to reference font metadata file. Defaults to Request with path and fallback set to [metadata.paths] and [metadata.fallbacks] respective referenceFont configurations.

  • mark (bool) – mark discrepant glyphs. Defaults to False.

  • color (tuple[int | float] | None) – Color value to apply when mark=True. Defaults to [color.marks] mark1 configuration. :param verbose: Make output verbose. Defaults to False

  • verbose (bool)

Return type:

None

generateMetadata

This script generates a full featured metadata JSON file for SMuFL fonts from metadata sources and user specifications, including the following metadata sections:

  • mandatory (fontName and fontVersion)

  • size

  • engravingDefaults

  • glyphAdvanceWidths

  • glyphsWithAnchors

  • glyphsWithAlternates

  • glyphBBoxes

  • ligatures

  • sets

  • optionalGlyphs

Sections are automatically added depending on the font’s scope and assigned values.

This script requires that SMufoLib be installed within its executive environment. It may also be imported as a module and contains the following public functions:

  • main() – Main function of the script.

main(font, targetDir, fontData=Request(CONFIG['metadata.paths']['referenceFont'], CONFIG['metadata.fallbacks']['referenceFont']))[source]

  • targetPath (str | Path) – Target directory for Metadata JSON file.

  • verbose (bool) – Make output verbose. Defaults to False.

  • fontData (str | Path | Request)

Return type:

None

importAnchors

This script sets glyph anchors based on data from a SMuFL font metadata JSON file (SMuFL’s reference font, Bravura, by default).

This script requires that SMufoLib be installed within its executive environment. It may also be imported as a module and contains the following public funcitons:

  • main() – main function of the script.

main(font, fontData=Request(CONFIG['metadata.paths']['referenceFont'], CONFIG['metadata.fallbacks']['referenceFont']), mark=True, colors=CONFIG['color.anchors'], clear=False)[source]

Main function of the script.

Parameters:

  • font (Font | Path | str | None) – font object to which the script applies.

  • fontData (Request | Path | str) – Object call or direct path to reference font metadata file. Defaults to Request with path and fallback set to [metadata.paths] and [metadata.fallbacks] respective referenceFont configurations.

  • mark (bool) – Apply defined anchor colors. Defaults to True

  • colors (dict[str, tuple[int | float, int | float, int | float, int | float]] | None) – dict of anchorNames mapped to UFO color values to apply when mark=True.

  • clear (bool) – erase preexisting anchors on append. Defaults to False.

  • verbose (bool)

Return type:

None

importID

This script imports Smufl identification attribute values for all the glyphs in a SMufoLib Font from metadata files. More specifically, it automatically sets the values for name, description and/or classes, based on the official metadata files of SMuFL and Bravura, or any other compatible sources.

If includeOptionals=True, optional alternates and ligatures require that such glyphs be named with reference to their base glyph (see this note for more information about glyph naming).

If overwrite=False, glyphs with preset attributes are skipped. Glyphs are also skipped if they are non-SMuFL members or if lookup fails (because the glyph is unencoded or the codepoint does not exist in the source metadata.

This script requires that SMufoLib be installed within its executive environment. It may also be imported as a module and contains the following public functions:

  • main() – Main function of the script.

main(font, attributes, classesData=Request(CONFIG['metadata.paths']['classes'], CONFIG['metadata.fallbacks']['classes']), glyphnamesData=Request(CONFIG['metadata.paths']['glyphnames'], CONFIG['metadata.fallbacks']['glyphnames']), fontData=Request(CONFIG['metadata.paths']['referenceFont'], CONFIG['metadata.fallbacks']['referenceFont']), includeOptionals=False, overwrite=False)[source]

Main function of the script.

Parameters:

  • font (Font | Path | str) – Object or path to target Font.

  • attributes (str | tuple[str, ...]) – ID attributes to be set. Value can be either 'name', 'classes', 'description' or tuple of several. Defaults to all.

  • classesData (Request | Path | str) – Object call or direct path to classes metadata file. Defaults to Request with path and fallback set to [metadata.paths] and [metadata.fallbacks] respective classes configurations.

  • glyphnamesData (Request | Path | str) – Object call or direct path to glyphnames metadata file. Defaults to Request with path and fallback set to [metadata.paths] and [metadata.fallbacks] respective glyphnames configurations.

  • fontData (Request | Path | str) – Object call or direct path to reference font metadata file. Defaults to Request with path and fallback set to [metadata.paths] and [metadata.fallbacks] respective referenceFont configurations.

  • includeOptionals (bool) – Include optional glyphs. Defaults to False.

  • overwrite (bool) – Overwrite preexisting values. Defaults to False.

  • verbose (bool) – Make output verbose. Defaults to False.

Raises:

  • TypeError – if any attributes value is not of the accepted type.

  • ValueError – if attributes value is not a valid ID attribute.

Return type:

None
